info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 9:23PM CDT until June 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River near Mammoth Cave affecting Edmonson County.
.Heavy rain from the past several days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Green River near Mammoth Cave.
* WHEN...Until Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Green River Ferry closes to RV and trailer traffic due to high water. Heavy loads will be at the judgment of the ferry operator considering the 12 ton load limit of ferry. Backcountry camping on the Green River floodplain is prohibited. At 20.1 feet, Launching of paddle craft is prohibited. At 32.0 feet, Green River Ferry closes to all traffic due to high water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 31.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 32.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.6 feet on 02/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon.Friday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING
